intro: Othera japonica, commonly known as Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. The botanical features of Othera japonica make it both ornamental and ecologically beneficial in its native habitat.
